intro: Fimbristylis marquesana, commonly known as the Marquesan sedge, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Pacific, including parts of Polynesia and Micronesia. The plant typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, where it forms dense, grass-like clusters. Its leaves are linear and often have a hairy texture, while its small, spike-like inflorescences produce numerous tiny flowers. The plant plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
